That's a great attitude to have! Meeting new people who share your passion for hiking can be incredibly rewarding, and having a hiking buddy or group of friends can definitely provide accountability and motivation to get out on the trails more often.

Sharing experiences and discussing adventures with like-minded people can also add a whole new level of enjoyment to your hikes. You'll be able to swap tips, recommendations, and stories, and learn from each other's experiences. It's also a great way to build new relationships and create lasting memories.

Having a hiking buddy or group can also help with safety, as you'll have someone to look out for each other and provide support if needed. Plus, it's always more fun to explore new trails with someone who understands your enthusiasm and passion for the outdoors!

Remember to be open-minded and patient when meeting new people, and don't be discouraged if it takes a few tries to find the right group or buddy. Keep attending events, and eventually, you'll find people who share your interests and values.

In the meantime, you might want to consider setting some goals for yourself, like exploring a certain number of new trails or completing a specific hike within a certain timeframe. Having goals can help keep you motivated and accountable, even if you don't have a hiking buddy or group right away.

What do you think is the most exciting part about meeting new people who share your interest in hiking? Is it the possibility of finding a new hiking buddy, exploring new trails, or something else entirely?
